channel.title: Bits, Bytes, Late Nights
channel.description: Recent content on Bits, Bytes, Late Nights

item.title: Notes
item.description: li { margin-bottom: 1.5em }; Computer Vision and Computational Photography — this guide provides a (relatively) gentle introduction to concepts and algorithms in both computer vision and computational photography, starting from basic image processing, building up to “old school” vision techniques like the Hough transform for shape detection and Lucas-Kanade for motion estimation, and closing out with modern machine learning algorithms like principal component analysis and hidden Markov models for facial recognition.

item.title: My Pescetarian Recipe Collection
item.description: A collection of tasty pescetarian recipes that I’ve gathered over the years with my personal tweaks and suggestions included.

item.title: Tracking Your Every Move Through Your Devices
item.description: Or, abusing MAC addresses for fun and profit (well, no profit unless you’re a massive corporation or the government…).

item.title: Hello there,
item.description: * { text-align: justify; } I’m George. I study computer science and sometimes cook things. I’m particularly interested in cryptography, peer-to-peer technologies, and applications of virtual and augmented reality. I like to write about these topics in various (albeit rare) posts. I also enjoy longboarding, rock climbing, and searching for the perfect nacho dish. You can also check out my \(\LaTeX\)’d notes for some of the graduate courses I’ve taken at the Georgia Institute of Technology.
